matrix.matrixComp

Class MatrixComputationFD

  • java.lang.Object
    • matrix.matrixComp.MatrixComputationFD
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MatrixComputation

    public class MatrixComputationFD
extends java.lang.Object
implements MatrixComputation
    Provides the implementation for performing arithmetic operations between dense float matrices. All operations are performed in a single thread.
    Author:
    Antonela Tommasel

      • invert

        public Matrix invert(Matrix m)
        Description copied from interface: MatrixComputation
        Returns the inverse or pseudo-inverse of matrix m. The implementation is based on the Colt implementation, which uses the LU or QR method. The returned Matrix is created with the same type than the original.

      • solveLeastSquare

        public Matrix solveLeastSquare(Matrix QR,
                      Matrix X,
                      float[] Rdiag)
        Least squares solution of A*X = B
        Parameters:
        QR - matrix to compute the pseudo-inverse (the A matrix in A*X = B)
        X - matrix where to build the solution
        Rdiag - diagonal values of QR
        Returns:
        X that minimises the two norm of Q*R*X-B, i.e. the pseudo-inverse of QR

      • solveQR

        public Matrix solveQR(Matrix m,
             float[] Rdiag)
        QR Decomposition, computed by Householder reflections. Implementation based on JAMA and Colt. For an rowSize x columnSize Matrix A with rowSize >= columnSize, the QR decomposition is an rowSize X columnSize orthogonal Matrix Q and an columnSize x columnSize upper triangular matrix R so that A = Q*R. The QR decompostion always exists, even if the matrix does not have full rank. The primary use of the QR decomposition is in the least squares solution of nonsquare systems of simultaneous linear equations.
        Parameters:
        m - matrix to decompose
        Rdiag - the diagonal of Matrix R
        Returns:
        the QR decomposition of Matrix m

      • solve

        public Matrix solve(Matrix LU,
           Matrix B,
           int[] piv)
        Solve A*X = B. It is used for computing the inverse of a matrix.
        Parameters:
        LU - matrix for which the inverse if found (represents the A in A*x = B)
        B - the result of the linear system. In the case of the inverse computation is the identity.
        piv - pivot of LU
        Returns:
        X the solution of the linear system

      • solveLU

        public Matrix solveLU(Matrix A,
             int[] piv)
        Returns the LU decomposition of a Matrix based on the Crout/Dolittle algorithm. For an rowSize X columnSize matrix A with rowSize >= columnSize, the LU decomposition is an rowSize x columnSize unit lower triangular matrix L, an columnSize x columnSize upper triangular matrix U, and a permutation vector piv of length rowSize so that A(piv,:) = L*U; If rowSize < columnSize, then L is rowSize X rowSize and U is rowSize columnSize n. The LU decomposition with pivoting always exists, even if the matrix is singular. The primary use of the LU decomposition is in the solution of square systems of simultaneous linear equations.
        Parameters:
        A - matrix to decompose
        piv - the pivot array
        Returns:
        the LU decomposition of Matrix m

      • invertByCholesky

        public Matrix invertByCholesky(Matrix m)
        Description copied from interface: MatrixComputation
        Returns the inverse computed by the Cholesky method for an arbitrary square Matrix. The implementation is based on the Colt implementation and the paper "Matrix Inversion Using Cholesky Decomposition". The returned Matrix is created with the same type than the original. Matrix m is first transformed into an Hermitian Matrix in order to the Cholesky to work. When it is applicable, the Cholesky decomposition is roughly twice as efficient as the LU decomposition for solving systems of linear equations. Consider Matrix D, the Hermitian A is computed as A = D*transpose(D). Then inverse(D) = transpose(D)*inverse(A)
        Specified by:
        invertByCholesky in interface MatrixComputation
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to be inverted
        Returns:
        the inverse
